solution: The equation, $9^n\cdot9^n\cdot9^n\cdot9^n=81^4$, can be written as $9^{4n}=81^4$. We also know that $81=9^2$, so we can rewrite the equation as $9^{4n}=9^{2(4)}$.  Solving for $n$, gives $n=\boxed{2}$.
chatgpt_solution: We have $9^n\cdot9^n\cdot9^n\cdot9^n=81^4$, which simplifies to $(9^n)^4 = 81^4$. Taking the fourth root of both sides of the equation results in $9^n=\sqrt[4]{81^4}$. Since $\sqrt[4]{81^4}$ is equal to 81, the equation can be rewritten as $9^n=81$. Taking the logarithm base 9 of both sides yields $\log_9 (9^n) = \log_9 81$, so $n = \boxed{2}$.
